oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Surgical saw of Dr. Charles Mayson of Georgia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Surgical saw of Dr. Charles Mayson (1823-1906). Dr. Mayson worked at Wayside Home for Confederate Soldiers, a hospital near Kingston, Bartow County, Georgia. This hospital was one of the earliest established by the Confederacy dating to August 1861. Mayson also served on an examing board in 1863 for the District of Georgia. The ivory handled metacarpal saw was made by Tiemann and Company around 1850. Tieman and Company of New York began making surgical equipment in 1826 and is still in operation.
